posts.post_content: This guy needs more credit for being a 2/4, especially with all of those 3/2 Blades these days. He can get in front of 4 of them and survive. And if he doesn't survive, at least you get a 1/1. Also I don't think 2W is a bad cost for a Elvish Visionary with Flash. Probably the most versatile of the cycle. I am just tired of so many 3 colour spells, but thats the theme.

Posted By: SavageBrain89 (5/6/2009 7:31:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: 3 stars. Instant speed blocking + card drawing will always be good, and is really good for 2W in limited. The fact that the token-making ability also works if he is put into a graveyard from play is really interesting too. I would say he is a decent pick mid/late-game for a bant deck because of the excellent cycling ability. I wish the body had been a 3/4 though, because as a 2/4 he is really too weak and too mana intensive to justify playing all the time.
posts.html:

I wish the body had been a 3/4 though, because as a 2/4 he is really too weak and too mana intensive to justify playing all the time.

posts.post_content:
SavageBrain89
  
   
This card at first glance looks unworthy of its Exalted theme, but the importance is with the cycling option it is attatched with. If your hand contains no useful sources, or something big comes your way, the cycling allows you to draw a card and flash in 1/1 to chump block the brute. The element here is to surprise your opponent.
